revised_title: Hortulan Communications on Engrafting Oranges, Lemons, and Citrons
tldr: The author discusses the curious phenomenon of engrafting oranges, lemons, and citrons onto one another's trees, as well as the growth of half-orange, half-lemon fruits on such trees. The text also mentions the possibility of keeping orange trees alive in winter without fire, using a special type of dung.
